column1: Multi-year sea ice area in Canadian Arctic sub-regions, 1968 to 2015

column2: Foxe Basin multi-year sea ice area (thousands of square kilometres)
column3: Kane Basin multi-year sea ice area (thousands of square kilometres)
column4: Baffin Bay multi-year sea ice area (thousands of square kilometres)
column5: Beaufort Sea multi-year sea ice area (thousands of square kilometres)

column1: Note: Sea ice is measured during the summer season. The summer season is defined as the period from June 25 to October 15 for the Canadian Arctic domain.
Source: Environment and Climate Change Canada (2016) Climate Research Division.
Available on the Canadian Environmental Sustainability Indicators (www.ec.gc.ca/indicateurs-indicators/default.asp?lang=En).
